definition: insect that eats into books, clothing etc/moth-eaten/worm-eaten
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: The advances in utilization of pheromones for integrated management of bark beetles are reviewed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 综述了信息素在小蠹虫综合治理中的应用进展。

sentences.english: This piece of cloth was eaten by a moth.

definition: insect that eats into wood, books, clothes etc/fig. vermin
insect that eats into books, clothing etc/moth-eaten/worm-eaten
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
